intro: Zeltnera venusta, commonly known as the velvetleaf zeltnera, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, velvety leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Zeltnera venusta is often found in desert scrub and chaparral ecosystems.
